edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility

Class RandomUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility.RandomUtility

  • public class RandomUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static members for generating random numbers.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz, Tim Harrington

        This function initializes the seeds of the random number generators to the specified values.
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed to initialize with

      • nextBernoulli

        public static int nextBernoulli(double p)
        This function returns a sample of a Bernoulli random variable with parameter p.
        Parameters:
        p - The probability of returning 1
        Returns:
        a Bernoulli random variable with probability p

      • nextUniform

        public static double nextUniform()
        This function returns a uniform random number in the open interval (0, 1).
        Returns:
        a double containing a uniform random number in (0, 1)

        This function returns a normal random number.
        Returns:
        a normally distributed random number

      • nextUniformInt

        public static int nextUniformInt(int from,
                 int to)
        Returns a uniformly distributed integer in the inclusive interval {from, ..., to}
        Parameters:
        from - the start integer
        to - the end integer
        Returns:
        an integer uniformly distributed in {from, ..., to}

      • nextUniformIntExcluded

        public static int nextUniformIntExcluded(int from,
                         int to,
                         int exclusion)
        This function returns an integer uniformly distributed in the set {from, ..., to} \ {exclusion}.
        Parameters:
        from - the lowest member of the set
        to - the highest member of the set
        exclusion - the member to exclude
        Returns:
        an integer uniformly distributed in {from, ..., to} \ {exclusion}

        normalize - whether to normalize the vector or not

        an array containing normally distributed random numbers

      • permute

        public static int[] permute(int[] values)
        This function computes a random permutation of the input array, and then applies the permutation. It performs the permutation in-place.
        Parameters:
        values - the array of integers to permute

      • randomSubset

        public static gnu.trove.TIntHashSet randomSubset(int subsetSize,
                                 int selectionSetSize)
        This function computes a random subset of size subsetSize from the set {0, ..., selectionSetSize - 1}.
        Parameters:
        subsetSize - the size of the subset to return
        selectionSetSize - the size of the set to select from
        Returns:
        a subset of size subsetSize from the set {0, ..., selectionSetSize - 1}
